attributes.action: Close the financial support gap for students taking a leave of absence
attributes.background: We call for the Department of Work and Pensions, in line with the policy of Student Finance England, to recognise students taking a leave of absence as no longer full-time students, and thus eligible to claim benefits including Housing Benefit, Income Support, JSA, and ESA and Universal Credit.
attributes.additional_details:
Students on a leave of absence are not considered to be full-time students by SFE, so their loan and maintenance payments stop. The DWP class these students as full-time and thus not eligible for state benefits. 

Students require leave for many reasons, such as illness, disability, bereavement, care duties, pregnancy and parental leave. Current rules place these students in a vulnerable position whereby they may have access to no support at all, pressuring them to drop out of their degrees.

attributes.action: Utilise Reading Prison as a Shelter for the Homeless
attributes.background: Reading currently has the highest number of homeless not only in Berkshire but in the South East; as taxpayers we're already paying for this building to be heated, the lights kept on and the water running, it just makes sense when there are people, our people, outside in the cold, wind and rain.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2013, Reading Prison which has a potential capacity to hold over 500 people, that has running water and still being heated, is just lying empty. 

So far it has cost the taxpayer in excess of a £1 Million to mothball. Unused for the last 5 years (save an art exhibition and the odd film production company using it for shooting locations), it seems to me almost criminal, when so many are in need of warmth and shelter to not utilise this for those of who find themselves homeless.

attributes.action: Increased funding for the police for dealing with anti-social behaviour.
attributes.background: As part of my Active Citizenship coursework I am taking action in my local area to reduce crime and make it a safer place.

attributes.action:
Justice for cats
Make it law to report hitting a cat
attributes.background: I lost my cat a few years ago to a taxi car speeding down my road my road s a no through road)  he new he had hit her but carried on to collect his ride. On the way back acknowledging he knew he hit her and left the seen. If she was a dog she would have had rights but cats don’t. Justice for cats.
attributes.additional_details: I love my cats as much as I loved my dog.

attributes.action: Allow students' placements to count towards 30 hours funded childcare criteria
attributes.background:
Students studying a degree with an integrated placement are required to have more contact hours than those without therefore for parents, childcare can be difficult to fund.
University limitations of number of hours students can work mean additional income to fund childcare is difficult to obtain.
attributes.additional_details:
It is grossly unfair that placement hours are not considered when deciding who should qualify for the additional funding.

This petition calls for the government to have a review of the guidelines regarding the eligibility of the additional 15 hours funded childcare for three and four year olds, and to introduce new criteria that allows students with integrated placements within their degree to have their placement hours taken into account when applying for additional funded childcare.

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to ban the practice of killing dogs inhumanly
attributes.background:
Thousands of dogs are annually tortured to death during the Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, boiled to death, beaten, burned and dismembered while still alive. 

Yulin began in 2009; it is not tradition. Nor is there a valid comparison bet

attributes.action: Issue statement on the draft Directive on copyright in the Digital Single Market
attributes.background: Proposal for a Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on copyright in the Digital Single Market in its current shape will severly impact the economic freedom and freedom of speech of all EU citizens if implemented. It favours big companies and research institutes over individuals.

attributes.action: Make employment businesses that supply electrical workers require a licence.
attributes.background:
Employment businesses/agencies that supply labour within the electrical trade are notorious with breaking the rules.

One of the most common problems is workers not being paid or having deductions made from there wages, both of which are illegal practices!
attributes.additional_details:
The EWB Propose a licensing system similar to the GLAA (http://www.gla.gov.uk/) to help protect the workers from these unfair practices.


The law is very clear on what an employment business/agency can and can't do but as it stands it is difficult to bring them to justice.

With a licence in place it makes the jobs of unions such as the IWGB:EWB easier to fight for fairness for workers.

Its time for change within the electrical industry and these unfair practices that break the law to change.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for transplant recipients
attributes.background: Transplant patients are on immune suppressants and anti-rejection medication for the rest of their life. As with a lot of other illnesses, they shouldn't have to pay for them.

attributes.action: Press the United Nations to make the dumping of all waste in the oceans illegal.
attributes.background: The only way to stop the polution of the oceans by plastic and other waste is to stop the dumping of urban waste at sea. The attempts that are being made to remove plastic and other waste from the oceans will only start to be effective once the dumping has stopped.

attributes.action: Fund Research to Prevent and Treat Asherman's Syndrome.
attributes.background: In 2009, I was pregnant with my one and only pregnancy. At my three-month scan, I was told there was no heartbeat and that I needed to have an ERPC. Following this I was diagnosed with Asherman's Syndrome, which then caused me to become infertile. This Silent Syndrome has been recognised since 1948.
attributes.additional_details: Asherman's Syndrome is scarring (adhesions) of the uterus. This scarring causes lighter periods or no periods at all and, in almost all women who are affected, infertility. It most often develops after a common minor operation called a D&C (dilation and curettage) and often following a missed miscarriage. In this case it's called an ERPC (evacuation of retained products of conception). It is estimated that around 60,000 - 100,000 D&Cs are carried out each year and many women remain undiagnosed.

attributes.action: The House of Lords may be in need of reform, but must not be abolished.
attributes.background: Given the power structures in Britain, its electoral system, and the lack of a head of state who can exercise oversight, a unicameral parliament would be a disaster.
attributes.additional_details:
Unelected as they are, they're still an essential part of the 3 pillars of State, in holding the executive to account.

The Lords has many experts in many fields.... to be an MP or part of the executive, you need NO qualifications, even to hold one of the great offices of State.... maybe the old school tie perhaps.

Unelected they do not fall foul of the virus that is populism which is what led to the rise of fascism in the 1930's

They are thus indispensable.

attributes.action: Remove forced adoption from Britain
attributes.background: In Ireland, France and Spain forced adoption is illegal; in Britain, it is not. Why have we got less parental rights?
attributes.additional_details:
The role of social services is to support families and protect children from abuse, that shouldn't include taking children away from their parents with no proof of abuse, and without trying to work with families; these children are being separated from siblings and put at much more risk. The children are then getting put up for adoption with family members still fighting to keep them; babies and toddlers are getting put up for adoption extremely fast without parents being found guilty of anything.

https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/couple-cleared-child-cruelty-reveal-6599877

https://forced-adoption.com/what-you-can-do/

attributes.action: Secretary of State for Northern Ireland should call a Border Poll on Irish unity
attributes.background: The Good Friday Agreement states that the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland must call a border poll on Irish unity if at any time it appears likely that a majority of those voting would express a wish that Northern Ireland should cease to be part of the UK and form part of a united Ireland.
attributes.additional_details:
Unfortunately the Good Friday Agreement does not state exactly how the SoS will judge the wishes of the majority.

We believe the question needs put to the people of NI so either way the discussion can be put to bed.

attributes.action: Bringing back a direct train service from London to Grimsby Return.
attributes.background:
For many years we have had to deal with the loss of business from Grimsby, the big blow was the loss of our direct connection to London via train.

I am starting this petition because I want to see the now publicly owned ECRL extend their London to Lincoln service to Grimsby or Cleethorpes.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a regular service which is run from London Kings Cross to Lincoln daily. It takes 1.55hrs from London to Lincoln. To get to Grimsby from Lincoln, it would take around an extra 20 -30mins directly. 

This would be overall a journey time of 2.30hrs - 2.40hrs from London to Grimsby. 

Grimsby is a great town and always has been. A huge amount of grimbrians have moved to london for work and have family still in Grimsby, more importantly it would bring much needed businesses to the area!

attributes.action: Increase the basic salary for NHS Dental Nurses
attributes.background: On average Dental Nurses get paid £8.29 an hour even though they have to study for 1 or more years to become qualified. Dental nurses deserve to be paid better for the level of skill and knowledge. The pay does not reflect the cost of being a dental nurse.

attributes.action: Safe staffing for pharmacy workers and patients.
attributes.background: I have personally worked within the pharmacy industry for over 10 years. During this time the NHS has suffered serious crises and GPs are under enormous pressure. In order to try and combat the extra pressure, more and more services are being passed onto pharmacists and other staff.
attributes.additional_details:
We need new laws on safe staffing. 

Despite the increase in services being brought into the pharmacies, staffing levels are at an all-time low. Often pharmacies are being left to run on just a pharmacist and one member of staff. This can lead to dispensing errors and put patients are risk. At the moment the pharmacists and staff can still be liable for prosecution when an error is made. The law should be changed to have safe staffing levels of at least two workers to safeguard workers and protect patients.

attributes.action: Redistribute 30 hours childcare funding to subsidise costs for children aged 1-4
attributes.background:
The current childcare funding is not available until a child is three years old. Consequently, there is a funding gap between the end of maternity leave and the start of the 30 hours funding. 

I propose we redistribute the funding to provide 15 hours childcare per week for children aged 1 to 4.
attributes.additional_details:
All parents are eligible for 15 hours funding for children aged 3 and 4. 

Families where both parents are working are eligible for an additional 15 hours funding for children aged 3 and 4. 

The current gap in childcare funding for children aged 1 and 2, means that childcare costs are one of the greatest barriers for parents returning to work. 

I propose we redistribute this entitlement so that families where both parents are working are eligible for the funding for children aged 1 and 2.

attributes.action: Make baby CPR compulsory in all antenatal classes within the hospitals
attributes.background:
As it stands parents have to pay to undergo a course to learn how to give CPR and how to deal with choking in infants and babies. 

After losing our son, we believe that no parent should have to pay to learn this skill.
attributes.additional_details:
We were taught how to give CPR and how to deal with choking when we were discharged from the neonatal unit as Johnny had been ill. This was part of their discharge procedure, however other parents are not taught this before leaving the hospitals. 

Our antenatal classes did not teach this basic skill either and all parents should be given the right on knowing what to do in an emergency.

attributes.action: We urge the Government to do more to identify PTSD in Service Veterans
attributes.background: PTSD is rapidly becoming the biggest killer of Service personnel. We need to do more to identify the condition before it takes over. Our Service personnel deserve the best after giving us so much, we cannot just throw them into a Society that doesn’t have the patience or understanding to accept them
attributes.additional_details: How many more veterans will die, feeling alone and full of guilt, self-loathing and unable to function?  It is a National disgrace that we lose these heroes every day because they are allowed to be ignored.  The first step is for the Armed Forces to counsel everyone and to provide a caring, professional solution.  This may involve the NHS even whilst these personnel are still serving.  If all three organisations work better together we can begin to understand more and provide a safer environment for them all

attributes.action: Prevent payment of EU ‘exit fee’ until a beneficial trade deal has been ratified
attributes.background:
The Government has offered to pay up to £39bn to the EU as an exit fee despite there being no legal requirement to do so.
Put it into law that not a penny should be paid until a final trade deal with demonstrable benefits to the UK economy has been signed and ratified by all EU member states.

attributes.action: Give the state pension to terminally ill people at early age
attributes.background: I’ve paid into the pension since 1976 and I’ve now got only a few years to live. I’m 58 now, but can’t get my pension. Who gets it when I die? The government. This is not fair.
attributes.additional_details: I’ve got motor neurone disease. I’ve no life because I have no memories to create with my partner and 16 year old daughter, because I have no free money left to do this. Getting my pension early would be a great help.

attributes.action: Grant healthstores a business rates dispensation
attributes.background: Independent healthstores play a vital role in supporting preventative health, saving the NHS millions of pounds annually.  As valuable assets who invest in the health of their local communities, healthstores deserve the same recognition and dispensation of £1000 currently awarded to Public Houses.

attributes.action: Make June 23 Independence Day! The day we voted for sovereignty and independence
attributes.background:
Two years ago we voted to Leave the EU.
We voted to take back control of our sovereignty and independence.
To mark that historic day, Britain should mark June 23 as Independence Day every year.

attributes.action: Ban plastic fishing nets as they make 46% of the plastic waste in the ocean.
attributes.background: Recently in the uk and across the globe, plastic straws are being banned from many restraunts. But did you know that that straws make up under 1% of ocean waste, but fishing nets make up a huge 46%. So instead of discriminating special needs people who need straws to drink ban fishing nets!

attributes.action: Fund a permanent memorial to soldiers killed in Northern Ireland
attributes.background:
On the 5th April 1979 Trooper Anthony Dykes along with Trooper Anthony Thornett of the Blues & Royals were killed in action whilst serving their country.

763 people gave the ultimate sacrifice in Northern Ireland whilst serving their country yet there is no permanent memorial to this.
attributes.additional_details:
My Grandparents are now in the later years of their life and have fought tirelessly for this to happen,they did a piece for ITV which I include a link below to:
http://www.itv.com/news/calendar/2017-03-27/couple-campaign-for-memorial-to-soldiers-killed-in-northern-ireland/

We owe it to those who gave their lives for their country to be honoured, I never had the chance to meet my Uncle but I am immensely proud of him for the sacrifice he gave to our country.

attributes.action: Allow Sativex for Fibromyalgia, CFS & Myalgic Encephalomyelitis
attributes.background: Allow the use of Sativex for the treatment of Fibromyalgia, CFS & M.E. Sativex is available on the NHS for MS. It can also help with the symptoms of Fibromyalgia, CFS & ME.
attributes.additional_details: There is not one specific drug that is designed for these conditions. There is little chance of finding medication to help relieve symptoms. Drugs prescribed can have damaging side effects and patients show little improvement after taking them. Sativex can relieve symptoms and should be allowed as a choice for the patient instead of opioids.

attributes.action: Change employee benefits/deductions calculation in relation to umbrella company
attributes.background: Change law/tax rules to ensure equal pay/benefits for agency workers using umbrella companies-paying workers less by avoiding Employers NI. ENI is deducted from workers’ wages.This petition seeks a law to prevent workers getting less take-home pay than directly employed people doing exact same job.
attributes.additional_details: There must be equal take-home pay for equal work for agency workers. Umbrella companies say that workers agree to work like this, but we know in the industry that this is not so and that workers are not given a choice and must go umbrella if they want to get employment. This is a widespread practice that is hurting the pockets of vulnerable workers.

attributes.action: To impose stricter laws for the use of horse drawn carts, and roadside tethering
attributes.background: The use of horse drawn carts is now widely known for severe health implications on the horse, as well as potentially dangerous to other traffic as roads get busier. Also Welfare of horses tethered to roadsides often with no shelter and minimal food, should be further considered by the government.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.nyclass.org/horse_drawn_carriages (a charity dedicated to the welfare of horses carrying carriages).                             -https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.loughboroughecho.net/news/local-news/video-man-filmed-riding-horse-12702592.amp.
-https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-york-north-yorkshire-29310503.
- M.Homer et al. 2007. X-ray alterations on spinal processes of 295 warmblood horses without clinical findings. Pferdeheilkunde 23 journal. Sep/Oct 507-511

attributes.action: Reinstate the old train timetable for Southern, Thameslink and Southeastern rail
attributes.background: On May 20 2018 the rail industry made the biggest changes to train times in a generation.  For the first three days of the new time table the operators could not run a full service or trains on time. There is too much pressure on key stations which continually will result in delays and disruption.
attributes.additional_details: There is countless news stories regarding this and the only option to resume a some what decent service is to reinstate the old timetable and take the pressure off key stations.

attributes.action: Open Family Courts up to public scrutiny
attributes.background: Family Court proceedings are not transparent. They are conducted away from public scrutiny. As a result there is little public awareness of the injustice many families experience and little accountability for poor judicial decisions. Anyone should be able to attend a Family Court hearing.
attributes.additional_details: The public interest lies in understanding how the law is being dispensed with regards to children and their parents. It lies in understanding the impacts these decisions have on our society. Hundreds of thousands of cases a year pass through the Family Courts unchecked with victims having no redress outside of cost prohibitive appeals to the Royal Courts of Justice. Public scrutiny of the system is required to ensure the process is efficient and protects the rights of both children and parents.

attributes.action: Create an independent enquiry to determine if foreign powers influenced Brexit.
attributes.background: With allegations of Russian interference in elections in other countries and elements of the Leave campaign facing allegations of violating spending rules that may have influenced the narrow outcome of the referendum, citizens have a right to know if Brexit truly is the will of the British people.
attributes.additional_details: It's everywhere in respected media outlets as well as American intelligence reports.

attributes.action: Change how Universal Credit is calculated for those receiving student income
attributes.background: Currently student income is deducted pound for pound as though it’s unpaid income. It should be treated the same as earned income and deducted 63p in the pound. Calculations should also be changed for Scottish students who receive monthly student income payments and can have no payments over summer.
attributes.additional_details: Many lone parent students, indeed any student, can find themselves in a position where they are up to £300 a month worse off under UC than under tax credits because of the current guidance on student income. We take out student loans out to fund our education to help us get to a position where we no longer require in work benefits and instead of being encouraged we are penalised. They don’t acknowledge bank loans as income so why are student loans deducted so harshly for calculation purposes!

attributes.action: The UK Government to regularly measure household food insecurity across the UK.
attributes.background: It's estimated that millions of people in the UK are food insecure. Food insecurity can vary from worrying about not being able to access enough food to going whole days without eating. Without regular monitoring, we cannot begin to understand the true scale of the problem nor its impact on health.
attributes.additional_details: Emma Lewell-Buck's Food Insecurity Bill would require the government to routinely monitor and report on food insecurity. Trussell Trust food bank statistics demonstrate growing food poverty but there are many more independent food banks and other food aid providers operating today. And we know that help is accessed as a last resort -  most food insecurity is hidden from view. Food insecurity is measured in Canada which means its health implications and long-term costs are understood.

attributes.action: Create a new offence of Infant Sexual Abuse with appropriate sentences
attributes.background: Infant Sexual Abuse causes lifelong complex PTSD. It manifests in physiological, neurological, mental, relational & social dysfunction in the survivor’s identity. Sexual abuse of a child aged six or under should be a separate criminal offence with similar sentences to murder.
attributes.additional_details: - everyone convicted of ISA should be given a life sentence with a minimum term set by a judge.

attributes.action: The Government must publish its own Brexit Impact/Risk Assessments
attributes.background: We are heading towards the end of the A50 period and only 6% of MPs have read them. On that basis they can't be that important or hinder the negotiations, therefore releasing them to the public won't be a problem.
attributes.additional_details: This was previously debated but times have changed.

attributes.action: Mandatory annual testing of Agricultural Trailers with a capacity of 10 tonnes +
attributes.background: Since the death of Harry, 19, due to faulty trailer brakes as a harvest worker, we call for mandatory annual trailer maintenance by qualified mechanics. Currently there is no road test for agricultural trailers, leading to many deaths by poorly adjusted and poorly maintained trailers.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to be changed to impose the mandatory testing of agricultural trailers that can carry a load of ten tonne or over. A professional mechanic should award an approved certificate when the required standard of maintenance has been reached. It should be a criminal offence for anyone not to have a certificate. This will create a policeable system of road safety that protects the operator and other road users.

attributes.action: Make animal welfare part of the schools curriculum.
attributes.background: Cruelty to animals is sadly a very common occurrence in the UK. Some is deliberate and some born out of ignorance. Respect, compassion and understanding for all animals is most important if we are to make any positive progress as a society.
attributes.additional_details:
It is appropriate to teach animal welfare in schools as many jobs and careers involve working with animals. We should have an understanding of what is involved in the farming of livestock, what actually takes place in a slaughterhouse and the fact that eating animals is not a necessity. 
Children should be made aware of the environmental impact of factory farming and large scale fishing. Facts regarding human nutritional requirements, exactly where and how animal products are obtained and our personal responsibility for all forms of life on earth needs to be studied.

attributes.action: Make Zoroastrianism a part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Schools should teach pupils about Zoroastrianism. It is one of the world's oldest active religions. It is the first monotheistic faith centered in a cosmology of good and evil and an eschatology predicting the ultimate destruction of evil. Ascribed by Zarathustra who lived almost 3,500 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Zoroastrianism enters recorded history in the 5th-century BCE. It served as the state religion of the pre-Islamic Iranian empires for more than a millennium, from around 600 BCE to 650 CE.  Zoroastrianism was suppressed from the 7th century onwards following the Muslim conquest of Persia of 633–654. In 2015, there were reports of up to 100,000 converts in Iraqi Kurdistan. Zoroastrianism has influenced the Second Temple Judaism, Gnosticism, Christianity, Islam, and Buddhism.

attributes.action: Reverse changes to state pension age back to 65 for men and 60 for women
attributes.background: I started paying into the N.I. system aged 16 when the retirement age was stated as 65 for men and 60 for women. I’ve been full time employed since then and have had the terms of the state pension age changed without consultation. Stand up and stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Look at the gov.uk website for the state pension change and what it means to you. You can get a personal projection so you can see how this new scheme will affect you personally.

attributes.action: Introduce screening for ovarian cancer
attributes.background: Age 29 my friend and I were dignosed with ovarian cancer. I had recieved an early dignoses but my friend was turned away by A&E and her GP. A healthy size 8 and look pregnant. Due to months of misdiagnosis she was told she had stage 4 cancer. She needed a miracle.
attributes.additional_details:
Ovarian cancer is the 4th most common cancer in women and no screening A blood test CA125 could detect. Our GP's are not educated enough and are unfamiliar with the symptoms. The symptoms are misdiagnosed with IBS.
Only 15% of women are diagnosed at early stage. 
We need to make awareness! Educate GP's and A&E doctors. We need screening.
I am now 30 a single mum of a 3 year old. If If I  hadn't pushed my GP I might not of been here now. Too many ladies have been affected by this disease.

attributes.action: End Business Improvement Districts: Stop this unfair Stealth Tax
attributes.background:
Stop unfair Stealth Tax 
A Business Improvement District (BID) is a defined area within which Businesses are forced to pay an additional TAX /LEVY. Traders have little or no control how this money collected by Councils on top of Business Tax is spent. This unfair legislation needs to be abolished.
attributes.additional_details:
BIDs are being allowed to creep in via undemocratic ballots. Central Government gives financial backing only to those wanting to establish a BID. This ignores and/or undermines any attempt at a NO campaign.

The Ministry of Communities, House and Local Government BID regulations are woefully inadequate and have allowed a culture of lack of BID accountability and transparency to run rife throughout the UK with no independent regulator.

attributes.action: Mental Health assessment and treatment, waiting times, published by October 2018
attributes.background: DOH is not directing its associated bodies, to present the waiting lists for public scrutiny and recognise. The waiting list is often over 18 months or longer. The data is easily collected and can be provided and we do not need to wait until April 2019 as promised it can be done ASAP.
attributes.additional_details: Autism services are an example, though the problem is across all services: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-44874939 another example of Students waiting for IAPT services: https://thebristolcable.org/2018/07/bristol-university-mental-health-suicide-students/

attributes.action: Automatic equal rights and shared custody for fathers
attributes.background: In some cases fathers are being denied access to their children. If not married, the mother does not have to name a father on the child's birth certificate. We have a current civil law process which allows and gives incentives to mother's who delay and outright deny access to children.
attributes.additional_details: There are some cases where some parents are considered unsafe around children and this of course should be the exception. But research proves that parental alienation and using children as weapons is damaging their development. Parental alienation should be considered as child abuse. Children can only be used as a weapon whilst our civil law allows it to happen. If both parents have equal rights and shared custody then the court process would rarely be required, only in cases of enforcement.

attributes.action: Require the prominent labelling of palm oil on all products sold in the UK
attributes.background: Palm oil plantations are a major reason of huge tracts of rainforest destroyed every day. Endangered species are being pushed towards extinction. Companies know that Palm oil is becoming well known as a problem ingredient and hide the product under dozens of different names making it hard to avoid.
attributes.additional_details: www.travelfordifference.com/list-palm-oil-free-products/

attributes.action: Stop returning failed asylum seekers to Zimbabwe before 30th July 2018 elections
attributes.background: UK Government is returning failed asylum seekers to Zimbabwe before the 30th July 2018 elections. There was a grenade thrown at one of the rallies , 2 people were killed and 50 injured. History has it that during and after elections in Zimbabwe there is instability and violence.
attributes.additional_details:
In a Presidential rally in the City of Bulawayo- Zimbabwe  a grenade was thrown and several people injured and 2 killed.

Several failed asylum seekers are being detained and removed from the UK during this precarious time facing an uncertain future.

attributes.action: Urge French government to stop profiteering from the 75th anniversary of D-Day
attributes.background: Some Normandy hotels are doubling their rates for veterans attending the 75th anniversary of D-Day.
attributes.additional_details: With so few D-Day veterans still alive, it is a disgrace that they and the families of deceased D-Day veterans are being forced to pay up to and exceeding double the usual rates charged by some hotels in Normandy. Have these men not paid enough already? I feel it appropriate that an official request is sent to the French government in the attempt of stopping such despicable exploitation of the final mass gathering of Normandy veterans. As an example, some hotels based in Caen have a usual rate of between 120 and 160 euros per night. One of the more prominent veteran's associations have just been quoted a rate of 300 euros per night for the week of 6th June, 2019. This is more than double the usual average.

attributes.action: Make retailers that sell drinks sell at least 30% of them in non plastic.
attributes.background:
Plastic is causing catastrophic effects in the environment we all live in. 
So why do many large, and small High Street retailers still sell ONLY plastic bottles of drinks? 
If there is a choice, people will be able to choose to not have plastic. The % should increase 10% each year for 4 years.
attributes.additional_details:
In our local NHS hospital a large multinational retailer only sells plastic bottled drinks.
A local chain of bakeries only sells drinks in plastic bottles.
There is already too much recyclable plastic that isn't recycled in the world. Drinks bottles use New plastic, not recycled plastic. Cutting down on New plastic for these drinks bottles will cut down the plastic that will then enter into the environment. 
Quicker, and easier to implement that a plastic bottle refund scheme.

attributes.action: Add age verified delivery option to Offensive Weapons Bill Section 15
attributes.background: please consider giving businesses an option to use an 'age verified delivery service' for residential addresses rather than a totally unnecessary outright ban, it will achieve the same goal but will not be as destructive to businesses, their employees and us as hobbyists

attributes.action: To make all schools and nursery’s nut free environments
attributes.background: I have two young children both with serious nut allergies. One is at infant school and one is a toddler. There are not that many nurseries or schools with nut free policies and our children spend a lot of time in these environments and we need to be sure that they are in safe hands on a daily basis.
